name: Front Raises with Plates
how_to_perform:
1. Hold a pair of weight plates in each hand at shoulder height, palms facing your thighs.
2. Engage your core and maintain good posture throughout the movement.
3. Keeping your arms straight, lift the weight plates forward and upward, keeping them level with your shoulders.
4. Pause briefly at the top of the movement.
5. Slowly lower the weight plates back to the starting position, squeezing your shoulder muscles as you do so.
6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, focusing on using your deltoids to lift and control the weight.
short_summary: Front raises with plates are an upper body exercise targeting the front delts.
